name: Mariana Snailfish
fact: The Mariana snailfish lives at depths of up to 8,000 meters and is one of the deepest-living fish ever found!
fact_level_1: I am the deepest swimming fish in the whole ocean! I look like a pink tadpole.

fact_level_2.size_details: Length: up to 11 inches. Weight: ~0.5 lbs (No significant gender difference).
fact_level_2.unique_fact: It has transparent skin that lets you see its liver!

name: Giant Tube Worm
fact: Giant tube worms can grow up to 2.4 meters long and have no mouth or stomach - they absorb nutrients through their skin!
fact_level_1: I have no mouth and no tummy! I live near hot underwater volcanoes.

fact_level_2.size_details: Length: up to 8 ft. Weight: N/A (Colonial).
fact_level_2.unique_fact: They survive on chemicals from the Earth's core, not sunlight.

name: Comb Jelly
fact: Comb jellies have been swimming in oceans for over 500 million years, making them one of the oldest animal groups!
fact_level_1: I don't sting like a jellyfish. I have rainbow lights running down my sides!

fact_level_2.size_details: Length: 4 inches to 5 feet. Weight: Negligible.
fact_level_2.unique_fact: They are the largest animals to swim using cilia (tiny hairs).

name: Deep Sea Cucumber
fact: Deep sea cucumbers can expel part of their internal organs to distract predators, then regrow them later!
fact_level_1: I crawl on the bottom of the ocean and eat the sand to clean it!

fact_level_2.unique_fact: Some can glow in the dark to warn predators.

name: Zombie Worm
fact: Zombie worms eat whale bones by drilling into them with acid!
fact_level_1: I don't eat brains! I like to eat old bones I find on the sea floor.

fact_level_2.unique_fact: They dissolve bone using acid secreted from their skin.

name: Ping Pong Tree Sponge
fact: This sponge has branches that look like ping pong paddles and can glow in the dark!
fact_level_1: I look like a weird tree with ping pong balls for leaves!

fact_level_2.unique_fact: Unlike most sponges, it is carnivorous and eats tiny shrimp.

name: Tripod Fish
fact: Tripod fish stand on three fin rays like a tripod to wait for food to drift by!
fact_level_1: I have three long stilts that let me stand on the mud without sinking!

fact_level_2.size_details: Length: 12-14 inches. Stilt Length: up to 3 ft.
fact_level_2.unique_fact: It stands facing the current to catch food drifting by.

name: Dumbo Octopus
fact: The dumbo octopus got its name from ear-like fins that look like Dumbo's ears!
fact_level_1: I flap my ear-fins to fly through the water like a cartoon elephant!

fact_level_2.unique_fact: It swallows its prey whole instead of chewing.

name: Faceless Cusk
fact: The faceless cusk has no visible eyes and its mouth is hidden underneath its head!
fact_level_1: I have no face! My mouth is underneath my head so I can scoop up food.

fact_level_2.unique_fact: It was rediscovered in 2017 after being missing for 140 years.

name: Abyssal Spiderfish
fact: Spiderfish have extra-long fins that let them walk on the ocean floor like a spider!
fact_level_1: I have super long fins that feel the water like spider legs!

fact_level_2.unique_fact: It uses its long fins to detect movement in pitch blackness.

name: Sea Pig
fact: Sea pigs are actually a type of sea cucumber that walks on the ocean floor with tube feet!
fact_level_1: I am a squishy pink tube with little legs. I look like a wet piglet!

fact_level_2.unique_fact: They often gather in herds of hundreds on the sea floor.

name: Ghost Shark
fact: Ghost sharks are ancient relatives of sharks that have been around for 400 million years!
fact_level_1: I am also called a Chimaera. I have lines on my skin that look like stitches.

fact_level_2.unique_fact: Their skeleton is made of cartilage, not bone.

name: Deep Sea Amphipod
fact: Deep sea amphipods can grow up to 34 centimeters long - much bigger than their shallow-water relatives!
fact_level_1: I am a giant version of a sand flea. I can be as big as your shoe!

fact_level_2.unique_fact: It can survive pressure that would crush a car.

name: Glass Sponge
fact: Glass sponges have skeletons made of silica, the same material glass is made from!
fact_level_1: My body is made of silica, which is the same stuff as glass windows!

fact_level_2.size_details: Height: up to 3 feet. Structure: Fragile.
fact_level_2.unique_fact: They can live for thousands of years.

name: Grenadier Fish
fact: Grenadier fish have huge heads and long, tapering bodies that look like a grenade!
fact_level_1: People call me a Rat-tail because my body tapers off into a long point.

fact_level_2.unique_fact: They have a huge head to house their sensory systems.

name: Cusk Eel
fact: Despite their name, cusk eels are actually fish, not eels!
fact_level_1: I am not a real eel, but I am very wiggly and slippery!

fact_level_2.unique_fact: The deepest fish ever recorded (27,000 ft) is a type of Cusk Eel.

name: Snipe Eel
fact: Snipe eels have jaws that curve away from each other, making them look like a pair of scissors!
fact_level_1: My jaws curve away from each other so I can't close my mouth!

fact_level_2.size_details: Length: up to 5 feet. Weight: Very light (<1 lb).
fact_level_2.unique_fact: It tangles its curved jaws into shrimp antennae to catch them.

name: Sea Angel
fact: Sea angels are actually swimming sea slugs that flutter through the water like angels!
fact_level_1: I am a swimming slug with little wings that make me look like an angel.

fact_level_2.unique_fact: Despite the name, they are voracious predators of Sea Butterflies.

name: Deep Sea Jellyfish
fact: Some deep sea jellyfish can glow with rainbow colors to attract prey!
fact_level_1: I glow red in the dark, which makes me invisible to other fish.

fact_level_2.unique_fact: Red light doesn't travel far underwater, so red animals look black.

name: Basket Star
fact: Basket stars are starfish with arms that branch out like a basket to catch floating food!
fact_level_1: I look like a mess of tangled tree roots wiggling in the water.

fact_level_2.size_details: Arm Span: up to 2 feet. Weight: 2-4 lbs.
fact_level_2.unique_fact: It curls into a tight ball during the day to hide.

name: Brisingid Starfish
fact: Brisingid starfish have up to 20 long arms that they use like fishing nets!
fact_level_1: I have so many arms! I raise them up to catch food falling from above.

fact_level_2.unique_fact: It is named after 'Brisingamen', the necklace of the goddess Freya.

name: Sea Pen
fact: Sea pens are colonies of tiny animals that work together like a single organism!
fact_level_1: I look like an old-fashioned feather pen stuck in the sand.

fact_level_2.unique_fact: They can uproot themselves and drift away if attacked.

name: Acorn Worm
fact: Acorn worms are close relatives of vertebrates and may show how our ancestors evolved!
fact_level_1: I smell like medicine (iodine) to stop fish from eating me!

fact_level_2.unique_fact: They breathe through their skin.

name: Monophore
fact: Monophores are strange deep sea creatures that filter food from the water using special tentacles!

name: Siphonophore
fact: The siphonophore can grow up to 50 meters long, making it longer than a blue whale!
fact_level_1: I am not one animal, but thousands of tiny clones holding hands!

fact_level_2.size_details: Length: up to 150 feet (Longer than a Blue Whale).
fact_level_2.unique_fact: Each segment has a specific job: eating, swimming, or floating.

name: Black Swallower
fact: The black swallower can eat prey 10 times its own size by unhinging its jaw!
fact_level_1: I have a stretchy tummy that can hold a fish twice my size!

fact_level_2.unique_fact: Sometimes they swallow so much food they float to the surface.

name: Lizardfish
fact: Lizardfish have needle-like teeth and can change color to match their surroundings!
fact_level_1: I have rows of sharp teeth, even on my tongue!

fact_level_2.unique_fact: They are one of the few deep sea fish that are hermaphrodites.

name: Spookfish
fact: Spookfish have a mirror-like lens in their eyes that helps them see in the dark!
fact_level_1: My head is see-through and my eyes can look up and down at the same time.

fact_level_2.unique_fact: It uses mirrors in its eyes to see, unlike any other animal.

name: Anglerfish
fact: Female anglerfish have a glowing lure that attracts prey in the dark depths!
fact_level_1: I have a fishing pole on my head with a glowing light to catch yummy fish.

fact_level_2.size_details: Female: Up to 3.3 ft. Male: Tiny (inches).
fact_level_2.unique_fact: The light comes from glowing bacteria living inside the lure.

name: Vampire Squid
fact: Despite its scary name, the vampire squid eats only tiny particles called marine snow!
fact_level_1: I wrap my red cape around myself when I am scared. I don't drink blood!

fact_level_2.unique_fact: It eats 'marine snow' (poop and dead scraps) falling from above.

name: Giant Squid
fact: Giant squids have eyes the size of dinner plates - the largest eyes in the animal kingdom!
fact_level_1: My eye is as big as a dinner plate! I battle sperm whales.

fact_level_2.unique_fact: It has the largest eyes in the animal kingdom.

name: Gulper Eel
fact: The gulper eel has a huge mouth that can swallow prey much larger than itself!
fact_level_1: My mouth is huge like a pelican! I can swallow things bigger than me.

fact_level_2.unique_fact: It has a glowing red light at the end of its tail.

name: Goblin Shark
fact: The goblin shark has a jaw that shoots out like a spring to catch prey!
fact_level_1: I can shoot my jaw out of my face to grab a snack!

fact_level_2.unique_fact: Its long nose is full of electrical sensors.

name: Blobfish
fact: Blobfish look normal in their deep-sea home but look blobby when brought to the surface!
fact_level_1: I look sad and squishy because I have no muscles. I just float!

fact_level_2.unique_fact: Under pressure deep down, it looks like a normal fish.

name: Lanternfish
fact: Lanternfish have light-producing organs called photophores that glow in the dark!
fact_level_1: I have tiny lights all over my belly. There are billions of us!

fact_level_2.unique_fact: They account for 65% of all deep sea fish biomass.

name: Hatchetfish
fact: Hatchetfish have bodies shaped like hatchets and can produce light to hide their shadow!
fact_level_1: I am as thin as a coin and look like a silver hatchet.

fact_level_2.unique_fact: They use 'counter-illumination' to hide their shadow from below.

name: Viperfish
fact: Viperfish have huge fangs that are so long they can't fit inside their mouth!
fact_level_1: My teeth are so long they curve over my face like a cage.

fact_level_2.unique_fact: It swims at high speed to impale prey on its teeth.

name: Dragonfish
fact: Dragonfish have a red light that only they can see, helping them hunt without being detected!
fact_level_1: I look scary, but I am very smallâ€”only the size of a banana!

fact_level_2.unique_fact: Some species produce red light, which acts like night-vision sniper scopes.

name: Fangtooth
fact: Fangtooth fish have the largest teeth relative to body size of any fish!
fact_level_1: I have the biggest teeth compared to my body size of any fish.

fact_level_2.unique_fact: It has special pockets in its brain so its teeth don't puncture its skull.

name: Frilled Shark
fact: The frilled shark is called a 'living fossil' because it has changed little in 80 million years!
fact_level_1: I look like an eel but I am a shark with 300 needle teeth.

fact_level_2.unique_fact: It is a 'living fossil' unchanged for 80 million years.

name: Coffinfish
fact: Coffinfish can puff up like a balloon and have a lure on their head like an anglerfish!
fact_level_1: I can puff up like a balloon and hold my breath to look big.

fact_level_2.unique_fact: It walks on the sea floor using its tiny fins.

name: Barreleye
fact: The barreleye has a transparent head so it can look up through its skull!
fact_level_1: My head is a clear bubble! The green balls inside are my eyes.

fact_level_2.unique_fact: Its eyes can rotate to look forward or straight up.

name: Cookiecutter Shark
fact: Cookiecutter sharks bite circular holes in their prey, like a cookie cutter!
fact_level_1: I am small, but I take round bites out of big whales like a cookie cutter!

fact_level_2.unique_fact: It glows green to trick fish into coming close.

name: Oarfish
fact: Oarfish can grow up to 11 meters long and are probably the source of sea serpent legends!
fact_level_1: I am the longest bony fish in the world. Sailors used to think I was a sea serpent.

fact_level_2.size_details: Length: up to 36 ft. Weight: 600 lbs.
fact_level_2.unique_fact: It swims vertically (straight up) to spot food silhouettes.

name: Big Red Jelly
fact: The big red jelly can grow up to 1 meter across and lives at depths of 650 meters!
fact_level_1: I am a giant red jellyfish that doesn't have stinging tentacles.

fact_level_2.unique_fact: Instead of stinging, it uses 'feeding arms' to grab prey.

name: Colossal Squid
fact: The colossal squid is heavier than a giant squid and has hooks instead of suckers!
fact_level_1: I am heavier than the Giant Squid and have spinning hooks on my arms!

fact_level_2.unique_fact: It hunts by waiting in the dark, conserving energy for months.

name: Six-Gill Shark
fact: Six-gill sharks are ancient predators that have been around since before the dinosaurs!
fact_level_1: Most sharks have 5 gills, but I have 6! I move very slowly.

fact_level_2.size_details: Length: up to 16 ft. Weight: 1,300 lbs.
fact_level_2.unique_fact: It is a scavenger that eats anything dead it finds.

name: Wolffish
fact: Wolffish have powerful jaws that can crush crabs, sea urchins, and clams!
fact_level_1: I have strong teeth to crush seashells. My blood has natural antifreeze!

fact_level_2.unique_fact: They produce a natural protein that keeps their blood from freezing.

name: Chimaera
fact: Chimaeras are related to sharks and have a single gill opening on each side!
fact_level_1: I have a venomous spine on my back and fly through the water.

fact_level_2.unique_fact: They detect magnetic fields to find buried clams.

name: Stoplight Loosejaw
fact: This fish has a lower jaw that can detach and swing forward to catch prey!
fact_level_1: I have a red light under my eye like a stoplight!

fact_level_2.unique_fact: Its jaw is hinged so openly it offers no water resistance when striking.

name: Flashlight Fish
fact: Flashlight fish have organs under their eyes that produce bright light!
fact_level_1: I have a pocket of glowing light under my eye that I can blink on and off.

fact_level_2.unique_fact: It blinks the light to confuse predators while it escapes.

name: Japanese Spider Crab
fact: Japanese spider crabs can have a leg span of up to 3.7 meters!
fact_level_1: I have the longest legs of any crab. I can step over a small car!

fact_level_2.unique_fact: It can live to be 100 years old.

name: Nautilus
fact: The nautilus has remained unchanged for 500 million years and uses jet propulsion to move!
fact_level_1: I live in a beautiful spiral shell and swim backwards.

fact_level_2.unique_fact: It adjusts its buoyancy by pumping gas into its shell chambers.

name: Sperm Whale
fact: Sperm whales can dive to 3,000 meters and hold their breath for 90 minutes!
fact_level_1: I have the biggest brain of any animal and I dive super deep.

fact_level_2.size_details: Male: 52 ft / 45 tons. Female: 36 ft / 15 tons.
fact_level_2.unique_fact: It hunts using echolocation clicks that are louder than a jet engine.

name: Beaked Whale
fact: Beaked whales can dive deeper than any other marine mammal - up to 2,992 meters!
fact_level_1: I look like a dolphin but I have a beak like a goose.

fact_level_2.unique_fact: It holds the record for the deepest dive of any mammal (9,800 ft).

name: Elephant Seal
fact: Elephant seals can dive to 1,500 meters and hold their breath for two hours!
fact_level_1: My nose looks like an elephant trunk! I make loud roaring noises.

fact_level_2.size_details: Male: 16 ft / 8,800 lbs. Female: 10 ft / 2,000 lbs.
fact_level_2.unique_fact: They can hold their breath for 2 hours.

name: Clownfish
fact: Clownfish are all born male and the largest one will turn into a female!

name: Blue Tang
fact: Blue tangs can change color based on their mood - they get darker at night!

name: Parrotfish
fact: Parrotfish sleep in a bubble of their own mucus to hide their scent from predators!

name: Lionfish
fact: Lionfish have venomous spines that can cause painful stings to humans!

name: Seahorse
fact: Seahorses are the only animals where males get pregnant and give birth!

name: Moray Eel
fact: Moray eels have a second set of jaws in their throat that grab prey and pull it down!

name: Pufferfish
fact: Pufferfish contain a poison 1,200 times more deadly than cyanide!

name: Butterflyfish
fact: Butterflyfish mate for life and can be seen swimming in pairs!

name: Angelfish
fact: Young angelfish have different colors and patterns than adult angelfish!

name: Sea Turtle
fact: Sea turtles can live over 100 years and return to the same beach where they were born to lay eggs!

name: Reef Shark
fact: Reef sharks can rest while swimming by using their tails to push water over their gills!

name: Manta Ray
fact: Manta rays have the largest brain of any fish and can recognize themselves in mirrors!

name: Cuttlefish
fact: Cuttlefish can change color and pattern in less than a second to communicate or hide!

name: Octopus
fact: Octopuses have three hearts and blue blood!

name: Giant Clam
fact: Giant clams can live over 100 years and can weigh up to 200 kilograms!

name: Boxfish
fact: Boxfish release a toxin when stressed that can kill other fish nearby!

name: Triggerfish
fact: Triggerfish can swim backward by using their second dorsal fin!

name: Sea Anemone
fact: Sea anemones can live for 50 years and some species can eat small fish!

name: Mandarinfish
fact: Mandarinfish are covered in a toxic mucus that protects them from predators!

name: Moorish Idol
fact: Moorish idols can change color when they sleep or get excited!

name: Napoleon Wrasse
fact: Napoleon wrasse can live over 30 years and are one of the largest reef fish!

name: Cleaner Shrimp
fact: Cleaner shrimp set up cleaning stations where fish line up to have parasites removed!

name: Stonefish
fact: The stonefish is the most venomous fish in the world and can be fatal to humans!

name: Barracuda
fact: Barracudas can swim up to 60 km/h and have been known to leap out of the water!

name: Trumpetfish
fact: Trumpetfish often swim vertically to blend in with sea fans and corals!

name: Nudibranch
fact: Nudibranchs are sea slugs that come in thousands of bright colors and patterns!

name: Sea Fan
fact: Sea fans are actually colonies of tiny animals that create a fan-shaped structure!

name: Brain Coral
fact: Brain corals can live for over 900 years and grow very slowly!

name: Bottlenose Dolphin
fact: Dolphins have names for each other - they use unique whistle signatures to identify friends!

name: Sea Otter
fact: Sea otters have the densest fur of any animal with up to 1 million hairs per square inch!

name: Manatee
fact: Manatees are known as sea cows and eat up to 10% of their body weight daily!

name: Stingray
fact: Stingrays have sensors on their faces that can detect the electrical fields of prey!

name: Starfish
fact: Starfish can regrow lost arms and some can even grow a whole new body from just one arm!

name: Hermit Crab
fact: Hermit crabs carry their homes on their backs and must find bigger shells as they grow!

name: Lobster
fact: Lobsters can live over 100 years and don't show signs of aging!

name: Sea Urchin
fact: Sea urchins have teeth that grow continuously and are made of the hardest material in nature!

name: Sand Dollar
fact: Sand dollars are flattened sea urchins that use tiny spines to move and bury themselves!

name: Pelican
fact: Pelicans can hold up to 11 liters of water in their throat pouch!

name: Seagull
fact: Seagulls can drink salt water because they have special glands that remove the salt!

name: Horseshoe Crab
fact: Horseshoe crabs have been around for 450 million years, longer than dinosaurs!

name: Fiddler Crab
fact: Male fiddler crabs have one giant claw they wave to attract females!

name: Flounder
fact: Flounder are born with eyes on both sides of their head, but one eye moves to the top as they grow!

name: Barnacle
fact: Barnacles stand on their heads and kick food into their mouth with their feet!

name: Jellyfish
fact: Jellyfish are 95% water and have been around for over 500 million years!

name: Sea Lion
fact: Sea lions can swim up to 40 km/h and can hold their breath for 20 minutes!

name: Harbor Seal
fact: Harbor seals can sleep underwater and surface automatically to breathe without waking up!

name: Great White Shark
fact: Great white sharks can detect one drop of blood in 100 liters of water!

name: Hammerhead Shark
fact: Hammerhead sharks have eyes on the sides of their head, giving them 360-degree vision!

name: Tiger Shark
fact: Tiger sharks will eat anything - tires, license plates, and even suits of armor have been found in their stomachs!

name: Sea Sponge
fact: Sea sponges can filter their entire body volume in less than a minute!

name: Scallop
fact: Scallops have dozens of eyes and can swim by clapping their shells together!

name: Oyster
fact: Oysters can change their sex multiple times during their lifetime!

name: Mussel
fact: Mussels produce byssal threads, often called 'beards', that are as strong as steel!

name: Conch Snail
fact: Conch snails have eyes on stalks and can jump by using their foot like a spring!

name: Krill
fact: Krill are the most abundant animal species on Earth with a total weight of 500 million tons!

name: Plankton
fact: Plankton produce half of the oxygen we breathe!

name: Cow
fact: Cows have best friends and get stressed when they're separated!

name: Pig
fact: Pigs are smarter than dogs and can learn to play video games!

name: Sheep
fact: Sheep can recognize up to 50 different human faces and remember them for years!

name: Goat
fact: Goats have accents - their bleats change depending on their social group!

name: Chicken
fact: Chickens have over 30 different vocalizations and can dream!

name: Rooster
fact: Roosters can tell time and often crow just before sunrise!

name: Duck
fact: Ducklings will follow the first moving thing they see - even if it's not their mother!

name: Goose
fact: Geese mate for life and mourn their dead partners!

name: Turkey
fact: Wild turkeys can fly up to 88 km/h but domestic turkeys can't fly!

name: Horse
fact: Horses can sleep standing up using a system of tendons and ligaments!

name: Donkey
fact: Donkeys have incredible memories and can recognize places they haven't seen in 25 years!

name: Pony
fact: Ponies are stronger than horses relative to their size!

name: Llama
fact: Llamas can carry up to 30% of their body weight and will spit when angry!

name: Alpaca
fact: Alpaca fiber is fire-resistant and comes in 22 natural colors!

name: Border Collie
fact: Border collies are the smartest dog breed and can learn over 1,000 words!

name: Golden Retriever
fact: Golden retrievers have 'soft mouths' and can carry eggs without breaking them!

name: Tabby Cat
fact: Tabby cats have an M pattern on their forehead that's believed to be from Mohammed's blessing!

name: Siamese Cat
fact: Siamese cats are born white and develop their points as they get older!

name: Goldfish
fact: Goldfish can recognize faces and can be trained to push levers for food!

name: Hamster
fact: Hamsters have pouches in their cheeks that can stretch to their shoulders!

name: Guinea Pig
fact: Guinea pigs can't make their own vitamin C and must get it from food!

name: Rabbit
fact: Rabbits can jump nearly 1 meter high and have 360-degree vision!

name: Ferret
fact: Ferrets sleep up to 18 hours a day and are most active at dawn and dusk!

name: Parakeet
fact: Parakeets can learn over 100 words and live up to 20 years!

name: Cockatiel
fact: Male cockatiels are better at talking and females are better at whistling!

name: Turtle
fact: Turtles can breathe through their butt when underwater!

name: Pot-bellied Pig
fact: Pot-bellied pigs can learn to use a litter box and respond to their name!

name: Mule
fact: Mules are smarter than horses and have better endurance than donkeys!

name: Brown Bear
fact: Brown bears can run up to 48 km/h and eat up to 40 kg of food per day!

name: Black Bear
fact: Black bears can climb trees even as adults and are excellent swimmers!

name: Moose
fact: Moose antlers can grow up to 2 meters wide and fall off every winter!

name: Elk
fact: Elk can jump 2.4 meters high and their antlers can grow 2.5 cm per day!

name: White-Tailed Deer
fact: White-tailed deer can run up to 48 km/h and jump 3 meters high!

name: Red Fox
fact: Red foxes have 28 different calls and can hear a watch ticking from 40 meters away!

name: Wolf
fact: Wolves can run for hours at 8 km/h and have 200 million scent cells!

name: Coyote
fact: Coyotes can mate with dogs and wolves and can jump 4 meters high!

name: Bobcat
fact: Bobcats can leap 3 meters to catch prey and have excellent night vision!

name: Lynx
fact: Lynx have huge paws that work like snowshoes to help them walk on snow!

name: Squirrel
fact: Squirrels can find buried nuts under a foot of snow using their sense of smell!

name: Chipmunk
fact: Chipmunks can carry food in their cheek pouches and store up to 8 kg of nuts for winter!

name: Beaver
fact: Beavers can hold their breath for 15 minutes and their teeth never stop growing!

name: River Otter
fact: River otters have waterproof fur and can close their nostrils and ears underwater!

name: Porcupine
fact: Porcupines have up to 30,000 quills that they can shoot out when threatened!

name: Skunk
fact: Skunk spray can be detected up to 3.5 km away and can cause temporary blindness!

name: Badger
fact: Badgers can dig through concrete and their jaws can lock onto prey with incredible force!

name: Woodpecker
fact: Woodpeckers can peck 20 times per second and have shock-absorbing skulls!

name: Blue Jay
fact: Blue jays can mimic hawk calls to scare other birds away from food!

name: Cardinal
fact: Cardinals don't molt their feathers so they stay bright red all year!

name: Eagle
fact: Eagles can see 4-7 times better than humans and can spot a rabbit from 3 km away!

name: Hawk
fact: Hawks can see in ultraviolet and track prey by following urine trails!

name: Falcon
fact: Peregrine falcons are the fastest animals, diving at over 320 km/h!

name: Wild Boar
fact: Wild boars have tough skin that can stop arrows and they're excellent swimmers!

name: Hedgehog
fact: Hedgehogs are immune to snake venom and can eat poisonous snakes!

name: Mole
fact: Moles can dig 15 meters of tunnel per hour and have a special thumb for digging!

name: Salamander
fact: Some salamanders can regrow entire limbs, including bones, muscles, and nerves!

name: Turkey Vulture
fact: Turkey vultures can eat diseased animals without getting sick and use vomit as defense!

name: Bengal Tiger
fact: Tigers have stripes on their skin as well as their fur - no two tigers have the same pattern!

name: Jaguar
fact: Jaguars have the strongest bite of all big cats and can crush turtle shells!

name: Leopard
fact: Leopards can carry prey 3 times their own weight up trees!

name: Gorilla
fact: Gorillas can learn sign language and have unique fingerprints like humans!

name: Chimpanzee
fact: Chimpanzees use tools, teach their young, and have been seen using medicine!

name: Orangutan
fact: Orangutans share 97% of DNA with humans and build nests in trees every night!

name: Howler Monkey
fact: Howler monkeys are the loudest land animals - their calls can be heard 5 km away!

name: Spider Monkey
fact: Spider monkeys have a prehensile tail that works like a fifth arm!

name: Capuchin Monkey
fact: Capuchin monkeys use tools to crack nuts and even use medicinal plants!

name: Lemur
fact: Lemurs have long tails for balance and communicate with scent markings!

name: Sloth
fact: Sloths are so slow that algae grows on their fur, helping them blend in!

name: Anteater
fact: Anteaters can eat 35,000 ants per day and have a 60 cm long tongue!

name: Armadillo
fact: Armadillos can jump 1 meter high when startled and always have identical quadruplets!

name: Tapir
fact: Tapirs are related to horses and rhinos and can use their nose as a snorkel!

name: Toucan
fact: A toucan's bill is one-third of its body length but is so light it can't affect balance!

name: Macaw
fact: Macaws can live over 80 years and mate for life!

name: Parrot
fact: Some parrots can live over 100 years and learn over 100 words!

name: Hummingbird
fact: Hummingbirds beat their wings 80 times per second and are the only birds that can fly backward!

name: Green Iguana
fact: Iguanas can hold their breath for 30 minutes and have a third eye on top of their head!

name: Chameleon
fact: Chameleons change color based on mood and temperature, not just camouflage!

name: Boa Constrictor
fact: Boa constrictors have heat-sensing pits and can swallow prey larger than their head!

name: Python
fact: Pythons can go a year without eating and have flexible jaws that unhinge to swallow large prey!

name: Anaconda
fact: Anacondas give birth to live young and can stay underwater for 10 minutes!

name: Poison Dart Frog
fact: One golden poison dart frog has enough poison to kill 10 humans!

name: Red-Eyed Tree Frog
fact: Red-eyed tree frogs flash their bright colors to startle predators, then escape!

name: Tarantula
fact: Tarantulas can regenerate lost legs and some species can live 30 years!

name: Leafcutter Ant
fact: Leafcutter ants don't eat leaves - they use them to grow fungus that they eat!

name: Okapi
fact: Okapis are the only living relatives of giraffes and have zebra-striped legs!

name: Barn Owl
fact: Barn owls have asymmetrical ears that help them pinpoint sounds in complete darkness!

name: Great Horned Owl
fact: Great horned owls can't move their eyes, so they can turn their heads 270 degrees!

name: Fruit Bat
fact: Fruit bats are essential pollinators for over 300 plant species!

name: Vampire Bat
fact: Vampire bats can walk, run, and jump and share blood with other bats who couldn't find food!

name: Raccoon
fact: Raccoons have 'hands' with five fingers and can remember solutions to tasks for 3 years!

name: Opossum
fact: Opossums play dead when threatened and can have up to 20 babies at once!

name: Aye-Aye
fact: Aye-ayes have a long middle finger they use to tap on wood and find insects!

name: Tarsier
fact: Tarsiers have the largest eyes relative to body size of any mammal!

name: Bush Baby
fact: Bush babies can leap 2.5 meters and have huge ears that help them hunt insects!

name: Sugar Glider
fact: Sugar gliders can glide up to 45 meters using a membrane between their legs!

name: Kinkajou
fact: Kinkajous have a 5-inch long tongue they use to reach nectar in flowers!

name: Fennec Fox
fact: Fennec foxes have huge ears that help them hear prey underground and release heat!

name: Hyena
fact: Hyenas are more closely related to cats than dogs and can digest bones completely!

name: Aardvark
fact: Aardvarks can dig 1 meter in 5 minutes and eat 50,000 termites per night!

name: Pangolin
fact: Pangolins are the only mammals covered in scales and can roll into a ball for protection!

name: Tasmanian Devil
fact: Tasmanian devils have the strongest bite relative to body size of any mammal!

name: Wombat
fact: Wombats have cube-shaped poop that doesn't roll away and they use it to mark territory!

name: Koala
fact: Koalas sleep 22 hours a day and have fingerprints almost identical to humans!

name: Scorpion
fact: Scorpions glow under UV light and can survive a year without food!

name: Firefly
fact: Fireflies flash in patterns to attract mates and some synchronize their flashes!

name: Moth
fact: Moths navigate by the moon and some can fly up to 60 km/h!

name: Gecko
fact: Geckos can walk on walls using microscopic hairs that create molecular attraction!

name: Cacomistle
fact: Cacomistles are related to raccoons and have rings on their tails like raccoons!

name: Civet
fact: Civets produce musk used in perfumes and some coffee beans pass through them!

name: Genet
fact: Genets can stand on their hind legs to look around and have retractable claws like cats!

name: Mouse
fact: Mice can squeeze through holes as small as a pencil and have ultrasonic hearing!

name: Rat
fact: Rats are excellent swimmers, can hold their breath for 3 minutes, and laugh when tickled!

name: Jerboa
fact: Jerboas can hop 3 meters high and use their tail for balance!

name: Polar Bear
fact: Polar bears have black skin under their white fur to absorb heat!

name: Arctic Fox
fact: Arctic foxes change color - white in winter, brown or gray in summer!

name: Arctic Wolf
fact: Arctic wolves can survive temperatures of -70Â°C and have two layers of fur!

name: Arctic Hare
fact: Arctic hares can run up to 60 km/h and change from brown to white for winter!

name: Walrus
fact: Walruses use their tusks to haul out of water and can weigh up to 1,500 kg!

name: Narwhal
fact: Narwhals have a 3-meter long tooth that looks like a unicorn horn!

name: Beluga Whale
fact: Beluga whales can change the shape of their forehead and are called 'canaries of the sea' for their songs!

name: Bowhead Whale
fact: Bowhead whales can live over 200 years, making them the longest-living mammals!

name: Orca
fact: Orcas are actually dolphins and each pod has its own unique dialect!

name: Harp Seal
fact: Harp seal pups can swim within minutes of birth and have pure white fur for the first few weeks!

name: Leopard Seal
fact: Leopard seals are the only seals that eat warm-blooded prey like penguins!

name: Weddell Seal
fact: Weddell seals can dive to 600 meters and use their teeth to chew holes in ice to breathe!

name: Emperor Penguin
fact: Emperor penguins can dive to 500 meters and males incubate eggs on their feet for 64 days!

name: Adelie Penguin
fact: Adelie penguins use pebbles to build nests and will steal them from each other!

name: Rockhopper Penguin
fact: Rockhopper penguins have spiky feathers on their heads and can jump 2.5 meters high!

name: Puffin
fact: Puffins can hold up to 10 fish in their beak at once!

name: Snowy Owl
fact: Snowy owls have feathers on their feet like snowshoes and hunt 24 hours a day in summer!

name: Musk Ox
fact: Musk oxen have underwool that's 8 times warmer than sheep's wool!

name: Reindeer
fact: Reindeer are the only deer species where both males and females have antlers!

name: Caribou
fact: Caribou can travel 5,000 km per year - the longest land migration of any animal!

name: Lemming
fact: Contrary to myth, lemmings don't commit mass suicide - they migrate when populations get too high!

name: Ptarmigan
fact: Ptarmigans have feathered feet that act like snowshoes and change color with seasons!

name: Wolverine
fact: Wolverines can take down prey 10 times their size and have teeth strong enough to break bones!

name: Stoat
fact: Stoats turn white in winter and perform hypnotic dances to mesmerize rabbits!

name: Ermine
fact: Ermines are stoats in their white winter coat and were once used to make royal robes!

name: Snow Goose
fact: Snow geese fly in formation that saves 70% energy for birds behind the leader!

name: Albatross
fact: Albatrosses can fly for hours without flapping their wings and can sleep while flying!

name: Krill (Antarctic)
fact: Antarctic krill can live for 10 years and use their bodies as a solar panel by eating ice algae!
